sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"礼物，赠品"之意。
means: gift ： 含义广，既可指真诚相送的礼物、赠品或生日、节日礼物，又可指捐赠的物品或捐款等。
present ： 普通用词，指给亲朋好友的礼物，赠者与被赠者之间存在某种个人关系，所赠礼物一般不是很昂贵的。
souvenir ： 指对人、物、地点或事件有纪念意义的礼物或纪念品。
tip ： 指为酬谢他人服务而给的小费。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这组动词均含有"给予，赠给"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: give, accord, award, confer，grant, endow, present, bestow
means: give ： 最普通用词，泛指将自己的东西给予他人，所给予的东西，物质或非物质的均可。
accord ： 侧重所给予的是应得的或是恰当的，或是因某种原因而适于接受的。
award ： 通常暗示所给予的东西是接受者应得的，而且给予者往往是具有裁判权力的。
confer ： 通常指授予称号或学位等。
grant ： 多指出于慷慨、怜悯或正义感而给予，并且通常是在被请求下给予。
endow ： 指捐赠大量的钱作基金，也可指给予非物质的东西。
present ： 指正式地给予或授予，通常伴有仪式进行。
bestow ： 正式用词，指把某物作为礼物赠送于某人，也可作引申用。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"现代的，当代的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: modern, contemporary, current, recent, present, up-to-date
means: modern ： 指现代或近代，时期可长可短。也可指新颖、时髦的。
contemporary ： 仅指当今这个时代，不涉及任何过去的时代。但可表示不同的人或物存在于同一时代。
current ： 指目前存在和发生的。
recent ： 表示新近的，最近的，时间的长短依据所修饰的人或物而定。
present ： 是这些词中语气最强的一个。指现在正发生、起作用的。
up-to-date ： 一般用于非正式场合，指很时新、能反映当前的最新发展。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"提出，提供"之意。
means: offer ： 最普通用词，多指主动提出或提供意见或东西等，但是否接受由对方自行决定。
present ： 既可指提出意见建议等，又可指拿出某物供人欣赏或赠送。
propose ： 指直接而主动地提出问题或建议等，也指在讨论或争辨中提出具体意见或建议。
volunteer与offer同义，侧重出于自愿，而不是受命做某事。

entry.def: You use present to describe things and people that exist now, rather than those that existed in the past or those that may exist in the future.

example.ex: He has brought much of the present crisis on himself...
example.tran: 目前的大部分危机都是他自己引起的。

example.ex: ...the government's present economic difficulties...
example.tran: 政府当前的经济难题

entry.def: The present is the period of time that we are in now and the things that are happening now.

example.ex: ...his struggle to reconcile the past with the present.
example.tran: 他为协调过去和现在所付出的努力。

example.ex: ...continuing right up to the present...
example.tran: 一直持续到现在

entry.def: In grammar, the present tenses of a verb are the ones that are used to talk about things that happen regularly or situations that exist at this time. The simple present tense uses the base form or the 's' form of a verb, as in 'I play tennis twice a week' and 'He works in a bank'.
A situation that exists at present exists now, although it may change.

example.ex: There is no way at present of predicting which individuals will develop the disease...
example.tran: 目前还没有办法预测谁会得这种病。

example.ex: At present children under 14 are not permitted in bars.
example.tran: 目前，14岁以下儿童不允许进酒吧。

entry.def: The present day is the period of history that we are in now.

example.ex: ...Western  European art from the period of Giotto to the present day.
example.tran: 从乔托时期直至现代的西欧艺术

example.ex: ...monastic music of the present day.
example.tran: 当代的寺庙音乐

entry.def: Something that exists or will be done for the present exists now or will continue for a while, although the situation may change later.

example.ex: The ministers had expressed the unanimous view that sanctions should remain in place for the present.
example.tran: 大臣们一致认为暂时还不能取消制裁。

entry.def: If you say 'There's no time like the present', you are suggesting to someone that they should do something now, not later.
entry.tran: 机不可失，失不再来；就在当下

example.ex: Don't wait until New Year to resolve to organise your life. There's no time like the present.
example.tran: 不要等到新年才下决心规划生活。要把握当下。

entry.def: If someone is present at an event, they are there.

example.ex: The president was not present at the meeting...
example.tran: 总裁没有出席这次会议。

example.ex: Nearly 85 per cent of men are present at the birth of their children...
example.tran: 将近85%的男性在他们的孩子出生时都在场。

entry.def: If something, especially a substance or disease, is present in something else, it exists within that thing.
entry.tran: （尤指物质、疾病）存在于…的，包含于…的

example.ex: This special form of vitamin D is naturally present in breast milk...
example.tran: 这种特殊形态的维生素D天然存在于母乳中。

example.ex: One theory is that the infection has been present in humans for a very long time...
example.tran: 有一种理论认为，这种传染病存在于人类中已经有很长时间了。

entry.def: A present is something that you give to someone, for example at Christmas or when you visit them.

example.ex: The carpet was a wedding present from the Prime Minister...
example.tran: 这张地毯是首相送的结婚礼物。

example.ex: I bought a birthday present for my mother...
example.tran: 我给母亲买了一份生日礼物。

entry.def: If you present someone with something such as a prize or document, or if you present it to them, you formally give it to them.

example.ex: The mayor presented him with a gold medal at an official city reception...
example.tran: 市长在一次正式的市政招待会上给他颁发了一枚金质奖章。

example.ex: Prince Michael of Kent presented the prizes...
example.tran: 肯特亲王迈克尔颁发了奖品。

entry.def: If something presents a difficulty, challenge, or opportunity, it causes it or provides it.

example.ex: This presents a problem for many financial consumers...
example.tran: 这给很多金融消费者带来了一个问题。

example.ex: The future is going to be one that presents many challenges...
example.tran: 未来将会面临诸多挑战。

entry.def: If an opportunity or problem presents itself, it occurs, often when you do not expect it.

example.ex: Their colleagues insulted them whenever the opportunity presented itself...
example.tran: 一有机会，同事们就会侮辱他们。

example.ex: A further obstacle has presented itself, however.
example.tran: 然而，突然又出现了一个障碍。

entry.def: When you present information, you give it to people in a formal way.

example.ex: We spend the time collating and presenting the information in a variety of chart forms...
example.tran: 我们花费时间用各种各样的图表来比照和展示这些信息。

example.ex: We presented three options to the unions for discussion...
example.tran: 我们向工会提供了3种选择供讨论。

entry.def: If you present someone or something in a particular way, you describe them in that way.

example.ex: The government has presented these changes as major reforms...
example.tran: 政府将这些变化描述为重大的改革。

example.ex: The British like to present themselves as a nation of dog-lovers...
example.tran: 英国人喜欢把自己说成是一个爱狗的民族。

entry.def: The way you present yourself is the way you speak and act when meeting new people.

example.ex: ...all those tricks which would help him to present himself in a more confident way in public.
example.tran: 能使他在公众面前表现得更为自信的那些窍门

entry.def: If someone or something presents a particular appearance or image, that is how they appear or try to appear.

example.ex: The small group of onlookers presented a pathetic sight...
example.tran: 这一小群旁观者看上去让人觉得悲哀。

example.ex: In presenting a more professional image the party risks losing its individuality.
example.tran: 为了给人一种更为职业的形象，该党可能会丧失自身特色。

entry.def: If you present yourself somewhere, you officially arrive there, for example for an appointment.

example.ex: She was told to present herself at the Town Hall at 11.30 for the induction ceremony...
example.tran: 她被告知于11点30分在市政厅参加就职仪式。

example.ex: We presented ourselves to the authorities promptly.
example.tran: 我们立即向当局备案。

entry.def: If someone presents a programme on television or radio, they introduce each item in it.

example.ex: She presents a monthly magazine programme on the BBC.
example.tran: 她在英国广播公司主持一个月刊节目。

entry.def: When someone presents something such as a production of a play or an exhibition, they organize it.

example.ex: The Lyric Theatre is presenting a new production of 'Over the Bridge'.
example.tran: 利里克剧院正在上演新排的《桥对面》。

entry.def: If you present someone to someone else, often an important person, you formally introduce them.

example.ex: Fox stepped forward, welcomed him in Malay, and presented him to Jack...
example.tran: 福克斯走向前，用马来语向他表示欢迎，并把他介绍给了杰克。

example.ex: Allow me to present my wife's cousin, Mr Zachary Colenso.
example.tran: 请允许我介绍我妻子的表哥，扎卡里·科伦索先生。

means.word_mean: 1. the period of time that is happening now; any continuous stretch of time including the moment of speech;

sentences.sentence: "he lives in the present with no thought of tomorrow"
"his tie was a present from his wife"

means.word_mean: 3. a verb tense that expresses actions or states at the time of speaking
1. show or demonstrate something to an interested audience;

sentences.sentence: "We will demo the new software in Washington"

means.word_mean: 2. bring forward and present to the mind;

sentences.sentence: "We cannot represent this knowledge to our formal reason"

means.word_mean: 3. perform (a play), especially on a stage;
7. give as a present; make a gift of;

sentences.sentence: "What will you give her for her birthday?"
"The commencement speaker presented a forceful speech that impressed the students"

means.word_mean: 9. cause to come to know personally;

sentences.sentence: "permit me to acquaint you with my son"
"introduce the new neighbors to the community"

means.word_mean: 10. represent in a painting, drawing, sculpture, or verbally;

sentences.sentence: "The father is portrayed as a good-looking man in this painting"

means.word_mean: 11. present somebody with something, usually to accuse or criticize;

sentences.sentence: "He was faced with all the evidence and could no longer deny his actions"

means.word_mean: 12. formally present a debutante, a representative of a country, etc.
13. recognize with a gesture prescribed by a miltary regulation; assume a prescribed position;

sentences.sentence: "When the officers show up, the soldiers have to salute"

means.word_mean: 1. temporal sense; intermediate between past and future; now existing or happening or in consideration;
2. spatial sense; being or existing in a specified place;

sentences.sentence: "the murderer is present in this room"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin praesent- 'being at hand', present participle of praeesse, from prae 'before' + esse 'be'
Middle English: from Old French presenter, from Latin praesentare 'place before' (in medieval Latin present as a gift), from praesent- 'being at hand' (see present)
Middle English: from Old French, originally in the phrase mettre une chose en present à quelqu'un 'put a thing into the presence of a person'
